page.title: 18THOMAS HILL, VANGUARD WORKS
page.content: Thomas Hill is situated at the side of the railway line. It is a small firm which manufactures locomotives as well as rebuilding and servicing them. Their workshops also service heavy duty diesel engines for earth movers and cranes. If a locomotive was something wrong with it, it is taken to Thomas Hill by lorry. Once there the locomotive is taken into the workshop and stripped down so the men can find out what is wrong. When it has been repaired, a lorry comes to take it back to its owners. A crane lifts the engine on to a lorry. When Thomas Hill build a new locomotive they use Rolls Royce engines. Locomotives from Thomas Hill can weigh from 25 to 75 tonnes and go all over the world.
